ShappeAli moved page [[Draft:Ahmed Azmeel]] to [[Ahmed Azmeel]]

revision.text:
'''Ahmed Azmeel''' is a Maldivian film actor. ==Career== Azmeel made his film debut in [[Aishath Rishmy]]-directed ''[[Fanaa (2010 film)|Fanaa]]'' (2010) alongside Rishmy and Aminath Rasheedha.{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/entertainment/3102 |title=Fanaa: Proof of Yaaraa’s immaturity |language=Dhivehi |work=Haveeru |last=Nafiz |first=Ali |date=15 July 2010 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100718092407/http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/?page=dates&date=2010-07-15 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=18 July 2010 |accessdate=18 July 2010 |df=dmy-all}} Based on a novel published by Waheed titled ''Balgish'', he played the role of a gangster. Upon release, the film received mixed to negative reviews from critics; Ali Naafiz from ''Haveeru Daily'' classified the film as the "worst Maldivian film released so far" during the year, criticing the performance of lead. However, other critics found the performance of Azmeel to be "good for a starter". His debut performance garnered him a nomination for [[Gaumee Film Award for Best Actor|Best Actor]] at the [[6th Gaumee Film Awards]] while winning the Best Male Debut award at the Enchanteur Maldives Film Awards 2012.{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/entertainment/123762 |title=Winners of Maldives Film Awards |language=Dhivehi |work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=5 July 2012 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150402094000/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/entertainment/123762 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=19 September 2018 |accessdate=19 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}}{{cite news|url=https://avas.mv/9322 |title=Yoope crowned Best Actor, Niuma received Best Actress, and Happy Birthday as the Best Film |language=Dhivehi |work=Avas |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=23 October 2015 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180924050337/https://avas.mv/9322 |deadurl=no |archivedate=24 September 2018 |accessdate=24 September 2018}} In 2016, Azmeel appeared in Hussain Munawwar's ''[[Neyngi Yaaru Vakivee]]'' alongside [[Aminath Rishfa]].{{cite news|url=https://sun.mv/70075 |title=Neyngi Yaaru Vakivee's First show full, Tickets available at four spots |language=Dhivehi |publisher=''Sun'' |date=26 February 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160606110604/https://sun.mv/70075 |archivedate=6 June 2016 |accessdate=6 June 2016}} Critics gave the film negative reviews and considered Azmeel's performance as Kamal, to be "boring" while criticising the character development.{{cite news|url=https://avas.mv/14598 |title=The actual reason of "Neyngi Yaaru Vakivee" |language=Dhivehi |publisher=''Avas'' |author=Nadheem, Ahmed |date=6 April 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160606101756/https://avas.mv/14598 |archivedate=6 June 2016 |accessdate=6 June 2016}} Despite the negative reviews, the film did average business at the end of its run.{{cite news|url=http://www.vaguthu.mv/evaguthu/entertainment/391632/ |title=Neyngi Yaaru Vakivee premiered to a positive response |language=Dhivehi |publisher=''Vaguthu'' |author=Jaishan, Ahmed |date=5 March 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160606110957/http://www.vaguthu.mv/evaguthu/entertainment/391632/ |archivedate=6 June 2016 |accessdate=6 June 2016}} His next release of the year was [[Ali Seezan]]-directed romantic film ''[[Vafaatheri Kehiveriya]]'' alongside [[Maleeha Waheed]].{{cite news|url=https://avas.mv/16116 |title="Vafaatheriya Kehiveriya" is almost complete: Seezan |language=Dhivehi |publisher=''Avas'' |author=Maahaa, Aishath|date=9 April 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160609121943/https://avas.mv/16116 |archivedate=9 June 2016 |accessdate=9 June 2016}} The film received a mixed to negative reception from critics.{{cite news|url=https://avas.mv/18132 |title="Vafaatheriya Kehiveriya" is not bad: Here is the reason behind its failure |language=Dhivehi |publisher=''Avas'' |author=Nadheem, Ahmed |date=5 June 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160606082514/https://avas.mv/18132 |archivedate=6 June 2016 |accessdate=6 June 2016}} [[Yoosuf Shafeeu]]-directed ''[[Baiveriyaa]]'' (2016), a comedy film featuring an ensemble cast was his second release of the year.{{cite news|url=https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/10286 |title=Last film of the year, "Baiveriyaa" releasing today |language=Dhivehi |work=Mihaaru |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=14 December 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180330145254/https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/10286 |deadurl=no |archivedate=30 March 2018 |accessdate=30 March 2018 |df=dmy-all}} The film revolves around an aspiring actress who flees from her family to pursue a career in the industry and the suspicions and confusions that arise.{{cite news|url=https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/11095 |title=Two shows of "Baiveriya" screening at olympus this week |language=Dhivehi |work=Mihaaru |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=3 January 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180330143550/https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/11095 |deadurl=no |archivedate=30 March 2018 |accessdate=30 March 2018 |df=dmy-all}} Upon release the film was positively received by critics. Nazim Hassan of ''Avas'' applauded the comic timing of the characters and mentioned that Azmeel showed "improvements from his earlier work".{{cite news|url=https://avas.mv/26970 |title=Baiveriyaa: A fun and entertaining film |language=Dhivehi |work=Avas |last=Hassan |first=Nazim |date=17 December 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180330145015/https://avas.mv/26970 |deadurl=no |archivedate=30 March 2018 |accessdate=30 March 2018 |df=dmy-all}} The film emerged as one of the highest grossing Maldivian films of the year.{{cite news|url=https://avas.mv/26970 |title=What was the best film of last year? |language=Dhivehi |work=Mihaaru |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=2 January 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180330150107/https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/10813 |deadurl=no |archivedate=30 March 2018 |accessdate=30 March 2018 |df=dmy-all}} In 2018, Azmeel appeared in Mariyam Moosa's directorial debut romantic film ''[[Thiya Loaibaa Dhurah]]''.{{cite news|url=https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/27018 |title="Thiya Loaibaa Dhurah" might turn out to be a beautiful romantic film |language=Dhivehi |work=Mihaaru |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=23 November 2017 |accessdate=18 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}} The entire film was shot in Sri Lanka.{{cite news|url=https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/33272 |title=A new teaser of "Thiya Loaibaa Dhurah" released |language=Dhivehi |work=Mihaaru |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=24 March 2018 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180328101423/https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/33272 |deadurl=no |archivedate=18 September 2018 |accessdate=18 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}} It was moderately received by critics; Aminath Lubaa reviewing from Sun praised the music and story of the film though she opined the performance from the actors including Azmeel, could have been better.{{cite news|url=https://sun.mv/104553 |title="Thiya Loaibaa Dhurah" review; a film for lovers |language=Dhivehi |work=Sun |last=Luba |first=Aminath |date=21 April 2018 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180918081157/https://archive.mv/dv/articles/6kdQ4 |deadurl=no |archivedate=18 September 2018 |accessdate=18 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}} In May 2018, it was premiered in Sri Lanka, and played two housefull shows at [[Mount Lavinia Hotel|Mount Lavinia Cinema]].{{cite news|url=https://raajje.mv/news/32308 |title=Two housefull shows of "Thiya Loaibaa Dhurah" showed in Lanka |language=Dhivehi |work=Raajje.mv |last=Waheed |first=Thahaarath Mohamed |date=11 May 2018 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180918081949/https://raajje.mv/news/32308 |deadurl=no |archivedate=18 September 2018 |accessdate=18 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}} ==Personal life== In May 2007, Azmeel married one of his co-stars [[Aishath Rishmy]]; with whom he shared screen space in many songs.{{cite web|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/entertainment/47345 |title=Rishmy and Azey getting married on thursday |publisher=''Haveeru Daily'' |author=Ahmed, Fazeena |language=Dhivehi |date=24 May 2007 |accessdate=8 October 2012 }}{{dead link|date=June 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} The couple were divorced in 2013. ==Filmography== {| class="wikitable sortable plainrowheaders" |- style="background:#ccc; text-align:center;" !scope="col"| Year !scope="col"| Title !scope="col"| Role !scope="col"| Notes ! scope="col" class="unsortable" | {{Tooltip|Ref(s)|Reference(s)}} |- | 2010 !scope="row"| ''[[Fanaa (2010 film)|Fanaa]]'' | {{n/a}} | Nominated—[[Gaumee Film Award for Best Actor]]
Enchanteur Maldives Film Award for Best Male Debut | style="text-align: center;"|
|- | 2016 !scope="row"| ''[[Neyngi Yaaru Vakivee]]'' | Kamal | | style="text-align: center;"| |- | 2016 !scope="row"| ''[[Vafaatheri Kehiveriya]]'' | {{n/a}} | | style="text-align: center;"| |- | 2016 !scope="row"| ''[[Baiveriyaa]]'' | Yanish | | style="text-align: center;"| |- | 2018 !scope="row"| ''[[Thiya Loaibaa Dhurah]]'' | Amir | | style="text-align: center;"| |- |} == References == {{Reflist|30em}} {{authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Azmeel, Ahmed}} [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Malé]] [[Category:21st-century Maldivian male actors]] [[Category:Maldivian male film actors]] {{actor-stub}}

Nazim Hassan of ''Avas'' applauded the comic timing of the characters and mentioned that Azmeel showed "improvements from his earlier work".{{cite news|url=https://avas.mv/26970 |title=Baiveriyaa: A fun and entertaining film |language=Dhivehi |work=Avas |last=Hassan |first=Nazim |date=17 December 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180330145015/https://avas.mv/26970 |deadurl=no |archivedate=30 March 2018 |accessdate=30 March 2018 |df=dmy-all}} The film emerged as one of the highest grossing Maldivian films of the year.{{cite news|url=https://avas.mv/26970 |title=What was the best film of last year? |language=Dhivehi |work=Mihaaru |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=2 January 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180330150107/https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/10813 |deadurl=no |archivedate=30 March 2018 |accessdate=30 March 2018 |df=dmy-all}} In 2018, Azmeel appeared in Mariyam Moosa's directorial debut romantic film ''[[Thiya Loaibaa Dhurah]]''.{{cite news|url=https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/27018 |title="Thiya Loaibaa Dhurah" might turn out to be a beautiful romantic film |language=Dhivehi |work=Mihaaru |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=23 November 2017 |accessdate=18 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}} The entire film was shot in Sri Lanka.{{cite news|url=https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/33272 |title=A new teaser of "Thiya Loaibaa Dhurah" released |language=Dhivehi |work=Mihaaru |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=24 March 2018 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180328101423/https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/33272 |deadurl=no |archivedate=18 September 2018 |accessdate=18 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}} It was moderately received by critics; Aminath Lubaa reviewing from Sun praised the music and story of the film though she opined the performance from the actors including Azmeel, could have been better.{{cite news|url=https://sun.mv/104553 |title="Thiya Loaibaa Dhurah" review; a film for lovers |language=Dhivehi |work=Sun |last=Luba |first=Aminath |date=21 April 2018 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180918081157/https://archive.mv/dv/articles/6kdQ4 |deadurl=no |archivedate=18 September 2018 |accessdate=18 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}} In May 2018, it was premiered in Sri Lanka, and played two housefull shows at [[Mount Lavinia Hotel|Mount Lavinia Cinema]].{{cite news|url=https://raajje.mv/news/32308 |title=Two housefull shows of "Thiya Loaibaa Dhurah" showed in Lanka |language=Dhivehi |work=Raajje.mv |last=Waheed |first=Thahaarath Mohamed |date=11 May 2018 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180918081949/https://raajje.mv/news/32308 |deadurl=no |archivedate=18 September 2018 |accessdate=18 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}} ==Personal life== In May 2007, Azmeel married one of his co-stars [[Aishath Rishmy]]; with whom he shared screen space in many songs.{{cite web|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/entertainment/47345 |title=Rishmy and Azey getting married on thursday |publisher=''Haveeru Daily'' |author=Ahmed, Fazeena |language=Dhivehi |date=24 May 2007 |accessdate=8 October 2012 }}{{dead link|date=June 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} The couple were divorced in 2013. ==Filmography== {| class="wikitable sortable plainrowheaders" |- style="background:#ccc; '''Ahmed Azmeel''' is a Maldivian film actor. ==Career== Azmeel made his film debut in [[Aishath Rishmy]]-directed ''[[Fanaa (2010 film)|Fanaa]]'' (2010) alongside Rishmy and Aminath Rasheedha.{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/entertainment/3102 |title=Fanaa: Proof of Yaaraa’s immaturity |language=Dhivehi |work=Haveeru |last=Nafiz |first=Ali |date=15 July 2010 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100718092407/http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/?page=dates&date=2010-07-15 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=18 July 2010 |accessdate=18 July 2010 |df=dmy-all}} Based on a novel published by Waheed titled ''Balgish'', he played the role of a gangster. Upon release, the film received mixed to negative reviews from critics; Ali Naafiz from ''Haveeru Daily'' classified the film as the "worst Maldivian film released so far" during the year, criticing the performance of lead. However, other critics found the performance of Azmeel to be "good for a starter". His debut performance garnered him a nomination for [[Gaumee Film Award for Best Actor|Best Actor]] at the [[6th Gaumee Film Awards]] while winning the Best Male Debut award at the Enchanteur Maldives Film Awards 2012.{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/entertainment/123762 |title=Winners of Maldives Film Awards |language=Dhivehi |work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=5 July 2012 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150402094000/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/entertainment/123762 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=19 September 2018 |accessdate=19 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}}{{cite news|url=https://avas.mv/9322 |title=Yoope crowned Best Actor, Niuma received Best Actress, and Happy Birthday as the Best Film |language=Dhivehi |work=Avas |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=23 October 2015 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180924050337/https://avas.mv/9322 |deadurl=no |archivedate=24 September 2018 |accessdate=24 September 2018}} In 2016, Azmeel appeared in Hussain Munawwar's ''[[Neyngi Yaaru Vakivee]]'' alongside [[Aminath Rishfa]].{{cite news|url=https://sun.mv/70075 |title=Neyngi Yaaru Vakivee's First show full, Tickets available at four spots |language=Dhivehi |publisher=''Sun'' |date=26 February 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160606110604/https://sun.mv/70075 |archivedate=6 June 2016 |accessdate=6 June 2016}} Critics gave the film negative reviews and considered Azmeel's performance as Kamal, to be "boring" while criticising the character development.{{cite news|url=https://avas.mv/14598 |title=The actual reason of "Neyngi Yaaru Vakivee" |language=Dhivehi |publisher=''Avas'' |author=Nadheem, Ahmed |date=6 April 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160606101756/https://avas.mv/14598 |archivedate=6 June 2016 |accessdate=6 June 2016}} Despite the negative reviews, the film did average business at the end of its run.{{cite news|url=http://www.vaguthu.mv/evaguthu/entertainment/391632/ |title=Neyngi Yaaru Vakivee premiered to a positive response |language=Dhivehi |publisher=''Vaguthu'' |author=Jaishan, Ahmed |date=5 March 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160606110957/http://www.vaguthu.mv/evaguthu/entertainment/391632/ |archivedate=6 June 2016 |accessdate=6 June 2016}} His next release of the year was [[Ali Seezan]]-directed romantic film ''[[Vafaatheri Kehiveriya]]'' alongside [[Maleeha Waheed]].{{cite news|url=https://avas.mv/16116 |title="Vafaatheriya Kehiveriya" is almost complete: Seezan |language=Dhivehi |publisher=''Avas'' |author=Maahaa, Aishath|date=9 April 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160609121943/https://avas.mv/16116 |archivedate=9 June 2016 |accessdate=9 June 2016}} The film received a mixed to negative reception from critics.{{cite news|url=https://avas.mv/18132 |title="Vafaatheriya Kehiveriya" is not bad: Here is the reason behind its failure |language=Dhivehi |publisher=''Avas'' |author=Nadheem, Ahmed |date=5 June 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160606082514/https://avas.mv/18132 |archivedate=6 June 2016 |accessdate=6 June 2016}} [[Yoosuf Shafeeu]]-directed ''[[Baiveriyaa]]'' (2016), a comedy film featuring an ensemble cast was his second release of the year.{{cite news|url=https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/10286 |title=Last film of the year, "Baiveriyaa" releasing today |language=Dhivehi |work=Mihaaru |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=14 December 2016 an aspiring actress who flees from her family to pursue a career in the industry and the suspicions and confusions that arise.{{cite news|url=https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/11095 |title=Two shows '''Ahmed Azmeel''' is a Maldivian film actor. ==Career== Azmeel made his film debut in [[Aishath Rishmy]]-directed ''[[Fanaa (2010 film)|Fanaa]]'' (2010) alongside Rishmy and Aminath Rasheedha.{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/entertainment/3102 |title=Fanaa: Proof of Yaaraa’s immaturity |language=Dhivehi |work=Haveeru |last=Nafiz |first=Ali |date=15 July 2010 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100718092407/http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/?page=dates&date=2010-07-15 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=18 July 2010 |accessdate=18 July 2010 |df=dmy-all}} Based on a novel published by Waheed titled ''Balgish'', he played the role of a gangster. Upon release, the film received mixed to negative reviews from critics; Ali Naafiz from ''Haveeru Daily'' classified the film as the "worst Maldivian film released so far" during the year, criticing the performance of lead. However, other critics found the performance of Azmeel to be "good for a starter". His debut performance garnered him a nomination for [[Gaumee Film Award for Best Actor|Best Actor]] at the [[6th Gaumee Film Awards]] while winning the Best Male Debut award at the Enchanteur Maldives Film Awards 2012.{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/entertainment/123762 |title=Winners of Maldives Film Awards |language=Dhivehi |work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=5 July 2012 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150402094000/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/entertainment/123762 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=19 September 2018 |accessdate=19 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}}{{cite news|url=https://avas.mv/9322 |title=Yoope crowned Best Actor, Niuma received Best Actress, and Happy Birthday as the Best Film |language=Dhivehi |work=Avas |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=23 October 2015 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180924050337/https://avas.mv/9322 |deadurl=no |archivedate=24 September 2018 |accessdate=24 September 2018}} The following year, Azmeel appeared in Aishath Ali Manik's romantic horror film ''Kuhveriakee Kaakuhey'' (2011) opposite [[Aishath Rishmy]]. Inspired by the horror romantic thriller [[Bollywood]] film ''[[Darling (2007 Indian film)|Darling]]'' (2007), pre-production of the film was started in 2007 and shot in [[Sri Lanka]]. It revolves around a man who cheats on his wife with his secretary, and how his life slides to a haunting shift when he accidentally kills his mistress. The film and his performance received negative reviews from critics. "Azmeel does not seem to be in his form this time; He is weak in delivering sequences with different emotions. He tries hard in the emotional grief scenes, but fails to impress the audience". The film did little business at boxoffice and was declared a flop.{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/?page=details&id=111640 |title="Kuhveriyakee Kaakuhey" Whose fault? |language=Dhivehi |work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=19 May 2011 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110828170507/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/?page=details&id=111640 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=3 October 2018 |accessdate=3 October 2018}} In 2016, Azmeel appeared in Hussain Munawwar's ''[[Neyngi Yaaru Vakivee]]'' alongside [[Aminath Rishfa]].{{cite news|url=https://sun.mv/70075 |title=Neyngi Yaaru '''Ahmed Azmeel''' is a Maldivian film actor. ==Career== Azmeel made his film debut in [[Aishath Rishmy]]-directed ''[[Fanaa (2010 film)|Fanaa]]'' (2010) alongside Rishmy and Aminath Rasheedha.{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/entertainment/3102 |title=Fanaa: Proof of Yaaraa’s immaturity |language=Dhivehi |work=Haveeru |last=Nafiz |first=Ali |date=15 July 2010 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100718092407/http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/?page=dates&date=2010-07-15 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=18 July 2010 |accessdate=18 July 2010 |df=dmy-all}} Based on a novel published by Waheed titled ''Balgish'', he played the role of a gangster. Upon release, the film received mixed to negative reviews from critics; Ali Naafiz from ''Haveeru Daily'' classified the film as the "worst Maldivian film released so far" during the year, criticing the performance of lead. However, other critics found the performance of Azmeel to be "good for a starter". His debut performance garnered him a nomination for [[Gaumee Film Award for Best Actor|Best Actor]] at the [[6th Gaumee Film Awards]] while winning the Best Male Debut award at the Enchanteur Maldives Film Awards 2012.{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/entertainment/123762 |title=Winners of Maldives Film Awards |language=Dhivehi |work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=5 July 2012 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150402094000/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/entertainment/123762 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=19 September 2018 |accessdate=19 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}}{{cite news|url=https://avas.mv/9322 |title=Yoope crowned Best Actor, Niuma received Best Actress, and Happy Birthday as the Best Film |language=Dhivehi |work=Avas |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=23 October 2015 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180924050337/https://avas.mv/9322 |deadurl=no |archivedate=24 September 2018 |accessdate=24 September 2018}} The following year, Azmeel appeared in Aishath Ali Manik's romantic horror film ''Kuhveriakee Kaakuhey'' (2011) opposite [[Aishath Rishmy]]. Inspired by the horror romantic thriller [[Bollywood]] film ''[[Darling (2007 Indian film)|Darling]]'' (2007), pre-production of the film was started in 2007 and shot in [[Sri Lanka]]. It revolves around a man who cheats on his wife with his secretary, and how his life slides to a haunting shift when he accidentally kills his mistress. The film and his performance received negative reviews from critics. "Azmeel does not seem to be in his form this time; He is weak in delivering sequences with different emotions. He tries hard in the emotional grief scenes, but fails to impress the audience". The film did little business at boxoffice and was declared a flop.{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/?page=details&id=111640 |title="Kuhveriyakee Kaakuhey" Whose fault? |language=Dhivehi |work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=19 May 2011 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110828170507/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/?page=details&id=111640 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=3 October 2018 |accessdate=3 October 2018}} In 2016, Azmeel appeared in Hussain Munawwar's ''[[Neyngi Yaaru Vakivee]]'' alongside [[Aminath Rishfa]].{{cite news|url=https://sun.mv/70075 |title=Neyngi Yaaru Vakivee's First show full, Tickets available at four spots |language=Dhivehi |publisher=''Sun'' |date=26 February 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160606110604/https://sun.mv/70075 |archivedate=6 June 2016 |accessdate=6 June 2016}} Critics gave the film negative reviews and considered Azmeel's performance as Kamal, to be "boring" while criticising the character development.{{cite news|url=https://avas.mv/14598 |title=The actual reason of "Neyngi Yaaru Vakivee" |language=Dhivehi |publisher=''Avas'' |author=Nadheem, Ahmed |date=6 April 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160606101756/https://avas.mv/14598 |archivedate=6 June 2016 |accessdate=6 June 2016}} Despite the negative reviews, the film did average business at the end of its run.{{cite news|url=http://www.vaguthu.mv/evaguthu/entertainment/391632/ |title=Neyngi Yaaru Vakivee premiered to a positive response |language=Dhivehi |publisher=''Vaguthu'' |author=Jaishan, Ahmed |date=5 March 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160606110957/http://www.vaguthu.mv/evaguthu/entertainment/391632/ |archivedate=6 June 2016 |accessdate=6 June 2016}} His next release of the year was [[Ali Seezan]]-directed romantic film ''[[Vafaatheri Kehiveriya]]'' alongside [[Maleeha Waheed]].{{cite news|url=https://avas.mv/16116 |title="Vafaatheriya Kehiveriya" is almost complete: Seezan |language=Dhivehi |publisher=''Avas'' |author=Maahaa, Aishath|date=9 April 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160609121943/https://avas.mv/16116 |archivedate=9 June 2016 |accessdate=9 June 2016}} The film received a mixed to negative reception from critics.{{cite news|url=https://avas.mv/18132 |title="Vafaatheriya Kehiveriya" is not bad: Here is the reason behind its failure |language=Dhivehi |publisher=''Avas'' |author=Nadheem, Ahmed |date=5 June 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160606082514/https://avas.mv/18132 |archivedate=6 June 2016 |accessdate=6 June 2016}} [[Yoosuf Shafeeu]]-directed ''[[Baiveriyaa]]'' (2016), a comedy film featuring an ensemble cast was his second release of the year.{{cite news|url=https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/10286 |title=Last film of the year, "Baiveriyaa" releasing today |language=Dhivehi |work=Mihaaru |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=14 December 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180330145254/https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/10286 |deadurl=no |archivedate=30 March 2018 |accessdate=30 March 2018 |df=dmy-all}} The film revolves around an aspiring actress who flees from her family to pursue a career in the industry and the suspicions and confusions that arise.{{cite news|url=https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/11095 |title=Two shows of "Baiveriya" screening at olympus this week |language=Dhivehi |work=Mihaaru |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=3 January 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180330143550/https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/11095 |deadurl=no |archivedate=30 March 2018 |accessdate=30 March 2018 |df=dmy-all}} Upon release the film was positively received by critics. Nazim Hassan of ''Avas'' applauded the comic timing of the characters and mentioned that Azmeel showed "improvements from his earlier work".{{cite news|url=https://avas.mv/26970 |title=Baiveriyaa: A fun and entertaining film |language=Dhivehi |work=Avas |last=Hassan |first=Nazim |date=17 December 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180330145015/https://avas.mv/26970 |deadurl=no |archivedate=30 March 2018 |accessdate=30 March 2018 |df=dmy-all}} The film emerged as one of the highest grossing Maldivian films of the year.{{cite news|url=https://avas.mv/26970 |title=What was the best film of last year? |language=Dhivehi |work=Mihaaru |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=2 January 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180330150107/https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/10813 |deadurl=no |archivedate=30 March 2018 |accessdate=30 March 2018 |df=dmy-all}} In 2018, Azmeel appeared in Mariyam Moosa's directorial debut romantic film ''[[Thiya Loaibaa Dhurah]]''.{{cite news|url=https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/27018 |title="Thiya Loaibaa Dhurah" might turn out to be a beautiful romantic film |language=Dhivehi |work=Mihaaru |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=23 November 2017 |accessdate=18 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}} The entire film was shot in Sri Lanka.{{cite news|url=https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/33272 |title=A new teaser of "Thiya Loaibaa Dhurah" released |language=Dhivehi |work=Mihaaru |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=24 March 2018 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180328101423/https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/33272 |deadurl=no |archivedate=18 September 2018 |accessdate=18 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}} It was moderately received by critics; Aminath Lubaa reviewing from Sun praised the music and story of the film though she opined the performance from the actors including Azmeel, could have been better.{{cite news|url=https://sun.mv/104553 |title="Thiya Loaibaa Dhurah" review; a film for lovers |language=Dhivehi |work=Sun |last=Luba |first=Aminath |date=21 April 2018 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180918081157/https://archive.mv/dv/articles/6kdQ4 |deadurl=no |archivedate=18 September 2018 |accessdate=18 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}} In May 2018, it was premiered in Sri Lanka, and played two housefull shows at [[Mount Lavinia Hotel|Mount Lavinia Cinema]].{{cite news|url=https://raajje.mv/news/32308 |title=Two housefull shows of "Thiya Loaibaa Dhurah" showed in Lanka |language=Dhivehi |work=Raajje.mv |last=Waheed |first=Thahaarath Mohamed |date=11 May 2018 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180918081949/https://raajje.mv/news/32308 |deadurl=no |archivedate=18 September 2018 |accessdate=18 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}} ==Personal life== In May 2007, Azmeel married one of his co-stars [[Aishath Rishmy]]; with whom he shared screen space in many songs.{{cite web|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/entertainment/47345 |title=Rishmy and Azey getting married on thursday |publisher=''Haveeru Daily'' |author=Ahmed, Fazeena |language=Dhivehi |date=24 May 2007 |accessdate=8 October 2012 }}{{dead link|date=June 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} The couple were divorced in 2013. ==Filmography== {| class="wikitable sortable plainrowheaders" |- style="background:#ccc; text-align:center;" !scope="col"| Year !scope="col"| Title !scope="col"| Role !scope="col"| Notes ! scope="col" class="unsortable" | {{Tooltip|Ref(s)|Reference(s)}} |- | 2010 !scope="row"| ''[[Fanaa (2010 film)|Fanaa]]'' | Aadhan "Aadey" | Nominated—[[Gaumee Film Award for Best Actor]]
Maldives Film Award for Best Male Debut | style="text-align: center;"|
|- | 2011 !scope="row"| ''Kuhveriakee Kaakuhey'' | {{n/a}} | | style="text-align: center;"| |- | 2016 !scope="row"| ''[[Neyngi Yaaru Vakivee]]'' | Kamal | | style="text-align: center;"| |- | 2016 !scope="row"| ''[[Vafaatheri Kehiveriya]]'' | {{n/a}} | | style="text-align: center;"| |- | 2016 !scope="row"| ''[[Baiveriyaa]]'' | Yanish | | style="text-align: center;"| |- | 2018 !scope="row"| ''[[Thiya Loaibaa Dhurah]]'' | Amir | | style="text-align: center;"| |- |} ==Accolades== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders sortable" |- !scope="col"| Year !scope="col"| Award !scope="col"| Category !scope="col"| Nominated work !scope="col"| Result ! scope="col" class="unsortable"| {{Abbr|Ref(s)|Reference(s)}} |- | 2015 ! scope="row" | [[6th Gaumee Film Awards]] | [[Gaumee Film Award for Best Actor|Best Actor]] | ''[[Fanaa (2010 film)|Fanaa]]'' | {{nom}} |style="text-align:center;"| |- |} == References == {{Reflist|30em}} {{authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Azmeel, Ahmed}} [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Malé]] [[Category:21st-century Maldivian male actors]] [[Category:Maldivian male film actors]] {{actor-stub}}

'''Ahmed Azmeel''' is a Maldivian film actor. ==Career== Azmeel made his film debut in [[Aishath Rishmy]]-directed ''[[Fanaa (2010 film)|Fanaa]]'' (2010) alongside Rishmy and [[Aminath Rasheedha]].{{cite news |url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/entertainment/3102 |title=Fanaa: Proof of Yaaraa’s immaturity |language=Dhivehi |work=Haveeru |last=Nafiz |first=Ali |date=15 July 2010 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100718092407/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/?page=dates&date=2010-07-15 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=2010-07-18 |accessdate=18 July 2010 |df= }} Based on a novel published by Waheed titled ''Balgish'', he played the role of a gangster. Upon release, the film received mixed to negative reviews from critics; Ali Naafiz from ''Haveeru Daily'' classified the film as the "worst Maldivian film released so far" during the year, criticing the performance of lead. However, other critics found the performance of Azmeel to be "good for a starter". His debut performance garnered him a nomination for [[Gaumee Film Award for Best Actor|Best Actor]] at the [[6th Gaumee Film Awards]] while winning the Best Male Debut award at the Enchanteur Maldives Film Awards 2012.{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/entertainment/123762 |title=Winners of Maldives Film Awards |language=Dhivehi |work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=5 July 2012 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150402094000/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/entertainment/123762 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=19 September 2018 |accessdate=19 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}}{{cite news|url=https://avas.mv/9322 |title=Yoope crowned Best Actor, Niuma received Best Actress, and Happy Birthday as the Best Film |language=Dhivehi |work=Avas |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=23 October 2015 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180924050337/https://avas.mv/9322 |deadurl=no |archivedate=24 September 2018 |accessdate=24 September 2018}} The following year, Azmeel appeared in Aishath Ali Manik's romantic horror film ''Kuhveriakee Kaakuhey'' (2011) opposite [[Aishath Rishmy]]. Inspired by the horror romantic thriller [[Bollywood]] film ''[[Darling (2007 Indian film)|Darling]]'' (2007), pre-production of the film was started in 2007 and shot in [[Sri Lanka]]. It revolves around a man who cheats on his wife with his secretary, and how his life slides to a haunting shift when he accidentally kills his mistress. The film and his performance received negative reviews from critics. "Azmeel does not seem to be in his form this time; He is weak in delivering sequences with different emotions. He tries hard in the emotional grief scenes, but fails to impress the audience". The film did little business at boxoffice and was declared a flop.{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/?page=details&id=111640 |title="Kuhveriyakee Kaakuhey" Whose fault? |language=Dhivehi |work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=19 May 2011 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110828170507/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/?page=details&id=111640 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=3 October 2018 |accessdate=3 October 2018}} In 2016, Azmeel appeared in Hussain Munawwar's ''[[Neyngi Yaaru Vakivee]]'' alongside [[Aminath Rishfa]].{{cite news|url=https://sun.mv/70075 |title=Neyngi Yaaru Vakivee's First show full, Tickets available at four spots |language=Dhivehi |publisher=''Sun'' |date=26 February 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160606110604/https://sun.mv/70075 |archivedate=6 June 2016 |accessdate=6 June 2016}} Critics gave the film negative reviews and considered Azmeel's performance as Kamal, to be "boring" while criticising the character development.{{cite news|url=https://avas.mv/14598 |title=The actual reason of "Neyngi Yaaru Vakivee" |language=Dhivehi |publisher=''Avas'' |author=Nadheem, Ahmed |date=6 April 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160606101756/https://avas.mv/14598 |archivedate=6 June 2016 |accessdate=6 June 2016}} Despite the negative reviews, the film did average business at the end of its run.{{cite news|url=http://www.vaguthu.mv/evaguthu/entertainment/391632/ |title=Neyngi Yaaru Vakivee premiered to a positive response |language=Dhivehi |publisher=''Vaguthu'' |author=Jaishan, Ahmed |date=5 March 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160606110957/http://www.vaguthu.mv/evaguthu/entertainment/391632/ |archivedate=6 June 2016 |accessdate=6 June 2016}} His next release of the year was [[Ali Seezan]]-directed romantic film ''[[Vafaatheri Kehiveriya]]'' alongside [[Maleeha Waheed]].{{cite news|url=https://avas.mv/16116 |title="Vafaatheriya Kehiveriya" is almost complete: Seezan |language=Dhivehi |publisher=''Avas'' |author=Maahaa, Aishath|date=9 April 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160609121943/https://avas.mv/16116 |archivedate=9 June 2016 |accessdate=9 June 2016}} The film received a mixed to negative reception from critics.{{cite news|url=https://avas.mv/18132 |title="Vafaatheriya Kehiveriya" is not bad: Here is the reason behind its failure |language=Dhivehi |publisher=''Avas'' |author=Nadheem, Ahmed |date=5 June 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160606082514/https://avas.mv/18132 |archivedate=6 June 2016 |accessdate=6 June 2016}} [[Yoosuf Shafeeu]]-directed ''[[Baiveriyaa]]'' (2016), a comedy film featuring an ensemble cast was his second release of the year.{{cite news|url=https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/10286 |title=Last film of the year, "Baiveriyaa" releasing today |language=Dhivehi |work=Mihaaru |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=14 December 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180330145254/https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/10286 |deadurl=no |archivedate=30 March 2018 |accessdate=30 March 2018 |df=dmy-all}} The film revolves around an aspiring actress who flees from her family to pursue a career in the industry and the suspicions and confusions that arise.{{cite news|url=https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/11095 |title=Two shows of "Baiveriya" screening at olympus this week |language=Dhivehi |work=Mihaaru |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=3 January 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180330143550/https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/11095 |deadurl=no |archivedate=30 March 2018 |accessdate=30 March 2018 |df=dmy-all}} Upon release the film was positively received by critics. Nazim Hassan of ''Avas'' applauded the comic timing of the characters and mentioned that Azmeel showed "improvements from his earlier work".{{cite news|url=https://avas.mv/26970 |title=Baiveriyaa: A fun and entertaining film |language=Dhivehi |work=Avas |last=Hassan |first=Nazim |date=17 December 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180330145015/https://avas.mv/26970 |deadurl=no |archivedate=30 March 2018 |accessdate=30 March 2018 |df=dmy-all}} The film emerged as one of the highest grossing Maldivian films of the year.{{cite news|url=https://avas.mv/26970 |title=What was the best film of last year? |language=Dhivehi |work=Mihaaru |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=2 January 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180330150107/https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/10813 |deadurl=no |archivedate=30 March 2018 |accessdate=30 March 2018 |df=dmy-all}} In 2018, Azmeel appeared in Mariyam Moosa's directorial debut romantic film ''[[Thiya Loaibaa Dhurah]]''.{{cite news|url=https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/27018 |title="Thiya Loaibaa Dhurah" might turn out to be a beautiful romantic film |language=Dhivehi |work=Mihaaru |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=23 November 2017 |accessdate=18 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}} The entire film was shot in Sri Lanka.{{cite news|url=https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/33272 |title=A new teaser of "Thiya Loaibaa Dhurah" released |language=Dhivehi |work=Mihaaru |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=24 March 2018 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180328101423/https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/33272 |deadurl=no |archivedate=18 September 2018 |accessdate=18 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}} It was moderately received by critics; Aminath Lubaa reviewing from Sun praised the music and story of the film though she opined the performance from the actors including Azmeel, could have been better.{{cite news|url=https://sun.mv/104553 |title="Thiya Loaibaa Dhurah" review; a film for lovers |language=Dhivehi |work=Sun |last=Luba |first=Aminath |date=21 April 2018 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180918081157/https://archive.mv/dv/articles/6kdQ4 |deadurl=no |archivedate=18 September 2018 |accessdate=18 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}} In May 2018, it was premiered in Sri Lanka, and played two housefull shows at [[Mount Lavinia Hotel|Mount Lavinia Cinema]].{{cite news|url=https://raajje.mv/news/32308 |title=Two housefull shows of "Thiya Loaibaa Dhurah" showed in Lanka |language=Dhivehi |work=Raajje.mv |last=Waheed |first=Thahaarath Mohamed |date=11 May 2018 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180918081949/https://raajje.mv/news/32308 |deadurl=no |archivedate=18 September 2018 |accessdate=18 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}} ==Personal life== In May 2007, Azmeel married one of his co-stars [[Aishath Rishmy]]; with whom he shared screen space in many songs.{{cite web|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/entertainment/47345 |title=Rishmy and Azey getting married on thursday |publisher=''Haveeru Daily'' |author=Ahmed, Fazeena |language=Dhivehi |date=24 May 2007 |accessdate=8 October 2012 }}{{dead link|date=June 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} The couple were divorced in 2013. ==Filmography== {| class="wikitable sortable plainrowheaders" |- style="background:#ccc; '''Ahmed Azmeel''' is a Maldivian film actor. ==Career== Azmeel made his film debut in [[Aishath Rishmy]]-directed ''[[Fanaa (2010 film)|Fanaa]]'' (2010) alongside Rishmy and [[Aminath Rasheedha]].{{cite news |url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/entertainment/3102 |title=Fanaa: Proof of Yaaraa’s immaturity |language=Dhivehi |work=Haveeru |last=Nafiz |first=Ali |date=15 July 2010 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100718092407/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/?page=dates&date=2010-07-15 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=2010-07-18 |accessdate=18 July 2010 |df= }} Based on a novel published by Waheed titled ''Balgish'', he played the role of a gangster. Upon release, the film received mixed to negative reviews from critics; Ali Naafiz from ''Haveeru Daily'' classified the film as the "worst Maldivian film released so far" during the year, criticing the performance of lead. However, other critics found the performance of Azmeel to be "good for a starter". His debut performance garnered him a nomination for [[Gaumee Film Award for Best Actor|Best Actor]] at the [[6th Gaumee Film Awards]] while winning the Best Male Debut award at the Enchanteur Maldives Film Awards 2012.{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/entertainment/123762 |title=Winners of Maldives Film Awards |language=Dhivehi |work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=5 July 2012 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150402094000/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/entertainment/123762 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=19 September 2018 |accessdate=19 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}}{{cite news|url=https://avas.mv/9322 |title=Yoope crowned Best Actor, Niuma received Best Actress, and Happy Birthday as the Best Film |language=Dhivehi |work=Avas |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=23 October 2015 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180924050337/https://avas.mv/9322 |deadurl=no |archivedate=24 September 2018 |accessdate=24 September 2018}} The following year, Azmeel appeared in Aishath Ali Manik's romantic horror film ''Kuhveriakee Kaakuhey'' (2011) opposite [[Aishath Rishmy]]. Inspired by the horror romantic thriller [[Bollywood]] film ''[[Darling (2007 Indian film)|Darling]]'' (2007), pre-production of the film was started in 2007 and shot in [[Sri Lanka]]. It revolves around a man who cheats on his wife with his secretary, and how his life slides to a haunting shift when he accidentally kills his mistress. The film and his performance received negative reviews from critics. "Azmeel does not seem to be in his form this time; He is weak in delivering sequences with different emotions. Aminath Lubaa reviewing from Sun praised the music and story of the film though she opined the performance from the actors including Azmeel, could have been better.{{cite news|url=https://sun.mv/104553 |title="Thiya Loaibaa Dhurah" review; a film for lovers |language=Dhivehi |work=Sun |last=Luba |first=Aminath |date=21 April 2018 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180918081157/https://archive.mv/dv/articles/6kdQ4 |deadurl=no |archivedate=18 September 2018 |accessdate=18 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}} In May 2018, it was premiered in Sri Lanka, and played two housefull shows at [[Mount Lavinia Hotel|Mount Lavinia Cinema]].{{cite news|url=https://raajje.mv/news/32308 |title=Two housefull shows of "Thiya Loaibaa Dhurah" showed in Lanka |language=Dhivehi |work=Raajje.mv |last=Waheed |first=Thahaarath Mohamed |date=11 May 2018 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180918081949/https://raajje.mv/news/32308 |deadurl=no |archivedate=18 September 2018 |accessdate=18 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}} ==Personal life== In May 2007, Azmeel married one of his co-stars [[Aishath Rishmy]]; with whom he shared screen space in many songs.{{cite web|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/entertainment/47345 |title=Rishmy and Azey getting married on thursday |publisher=''Haveeru Daily'' |author=Ahmed, Fazeena |language=Dhivehi |date=24 May 2007 |accessdate=8 October 2012 }}{{dead link|date=June 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} The couple were divorced in 2013. ==Filmography== {| class="wikitable sortable plainrowheaders" |- style="background:#ccc; '''Ahmed Azmeel''' is a Maldivian film actor. ==Career== Azmeel made his film debut in [[Aishath Rishmy]]-directed ''[[Fanaa (2010 film)|Fanaa]]'' (2010) alongside Rishmy and [[Aminath Rasheedha]].{{cite news |url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/entertainment/3102 |title=Fanaa: Proof of Yaaraa’s immaturity |language=Dhivehi |work=Haveeru |last=Nafiz |first=Ali |date=15 July 2010 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100718092407/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/?page=dates&date=2010-07-15 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=2010-07-18 |accessdate=18 July 2010 |df= }} Based on a novel published by Waheed titled ''Balgish'', he played the role of a gangster. Upon release, the film received mixed to negative reviews from critics; Ali Naafiz from ''Haveeru Daily'' classified the film as the "worst Maldivian film released so far" during the year, criticing the performance of lead. However, other critics found the performance of Azmeel to be "good for a starter". His debut performance garnered him a nomination for [[Gaumee Film Award for Best Actor|Best Actor]] at the [[6th Gaumee Film Awards]] while winning the Best Male Debut award at the Enchanteur Maldives Film Awards 2012.{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/entertainment/123762 |title=Winners of Maldives Film Awards |language=Dhivehi |work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=5 July 2012 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150402094000/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/entertainment/123762 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=19 September 2018 |accessdate=19 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}}{{cite news|url=https://avas.mv/9322 |title=Yoope crowned Best Actor, Niuma received Best Actress, and Happy Birthday as the Best Film |language=Dhivehi |work=Avas |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=23 October 2015 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180924050337/https://avas.mv/9322 |deadurl=no |archivedate=24 September 2018 |accessdate=24 September 2018}} The following year, Azmeel appeared in Aishath Ali Manik's romantic horror film ''[[Kuhveriakee Kaakuhey?]]'' (2011) opposite [[Aishath Rishmy]]. Inspired by the horror romantic thriller [[Bollywood]] film ''[[Darling (2007 Indian film)|Darling]]'' (2007), pre-production of the film was started in 2007 and shot in [[Sri Lanka]]. It revolves around a man who cheats on his wife with his secretary, and how his life slides to a haunting shift when he accidentally kills his mistress. The film and his performance received negative reviews from critics. "Azmeel does not seem to be in his form this time; He is weak in delivering sequences with different emotions. He tries hard in the emotional grief scenes, but fails to impress the audience". The film did little business at boxoffice and was declared a flop.{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/?page=details&id=111640 |title="Kuhveriyakee Kaakuhey" Whose fault? |language=Dhivehi |work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=19 May 2011 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110828170507/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/?page=details&id=111640 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=3 October 2018 |accessdate=3 October 2018}} In 2016, Azmeel appeared in Hussain Munawwar's ''[[Neyngi Yaaru Vakivee]]'' alongside [[Aminath Rishfa]].{{cite news|url=https://sun.mv/70075 |title=Neyngi Yaaru '''Ahmed Azmeel''' is a Maldivian film actor. ==Career== Azmeel made his film debut in [[Aishath Rishmy]]-directed ''[[Fanaa (2010 film)|Fanaa]]'' (2010) alongside Rishmy and [[Aminath Rasheedha]].{{cite news |url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/entertainment/3102 |title=Fanaa: Proof of Yaaraa’s immaturity |language=Dhivehi |work=Haveeru |last=Nafiz |first=Ali |date=15 July 2010 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100718092407/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/?page=dates&date=2010-07-15 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=2010-07-18 |accessdate=18 July 2010 |df= }} Based on a novel published by Waheed titled ''Balgish'', he played the role of a gangster. Upon release, the film received mixed to negative reviews from critics; Ali Naafiz from ''Haveeru Daily'' classified the film as the "worst Maldivian film released so far" during the year, criticing the performance of lead. However, other critics found the performance of Azmeel to be "good for a starter". His debut performance garnered him a nomination for [[Gaumee Film Award for Best Actor|Best Actor]] at the [[6th Gaumee Film Awards]] while winning the Best Male Debut award at the Enchanteur Maldives Film Awards 2012.{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/entertainment/123762 |title=Winners of Maldives Film Awards |language=Dhivehi |work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=5 July 2012 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150402094000/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/entertainment/123762 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=19 September 2018 |accessdate=19 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}}{{cite news|url=https://avas.mv/9322 |title=Yoope crowned Best Actor, Niuma received Best Actress, and Happy Birthday as the Best Film |language=Dhivehi |work=Avas |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=23 October 2015 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180924050337/https://avas.mv/9322 |deadurl=no |archivedate=24 September 2018 |accessdate=24 September 2018}} The following year, Azmeel appeared in Aishath Ali Manik's romantic horror film ''[[Kuhveriakee Kaakuhey?]]'' (2011) opposite [[Aishath Rishmy]]. Inspired by the horror romantic thriller [[Bollywood]] film ''[[Darling (2007 Indian film)|Darling]]'' (2007), pre-production of the film was started in 2007 and shot in [[Sri Lanka]]. It revolves around a man who cheats on his wife with his secretary, and how his life slides to a haunting shift when he accidentally kills his mistress. The film and his performance received negative reviews from critics. "Azmeel does not seem to be in his form this time; He is weak in delivering sequences with different emotions. He tries hard in the emotional grief scenes, but fails to impress the audience". The film did little business at boxoffice and was declared a flop.{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/?page=details&id=111640 |title="Kuhveriyakee Kaakuhey" Whose fault? |language=Dhivehi |work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=19 May 2011 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110828170507/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/?page=details&id=111640 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=3 October 2018 |accessdate=3 October 2018}} His next release was a family drama ''Hiyy Yaara Dheefa'' (2011), written and directed by him, starred alongside [[Aishath Rishmy]], [[Niuma Mohamed]], [[Ali Seezan]] and [[Aminath Rasheedha]].{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/dhivehi/entertainment/maldives_film_industry/111417 |title="Hiyy Yaaraa Dheefa" premiered |language=Dhivehi |work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=13 October 2011 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111014210956/http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/dhivehi/entertainment/maldives_film_industry/111417 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=11 October 2018 |accessdate=11 October 2018}} The film received negative reviews from critics pointing similarities between [[Bollywood]] [[comedy-drama film]] ''[[Ishq (1997 film)|Ishq]]'' (1997) and [[Kundan Shah]]'s family drama ''[[Dil Hai Tumhaara]]'' (2002). He played Isham, a poor boy who falls in love with a rich girl. The film did not succeed financially, and his work as a writer, actor and director was disapproved by critics.{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/dhivehi/entertainment/111747 |title="Hiyy '''Ahmed Azmeel''' is a Maldivian film actor. ==Career== Azmeel made his film debut in [[Aishath Rishmy]]-directed ''[[Fanaa (2010 film)|Fanaa]]'' (2010) alongside Rishmy and [[Aminath Rasheedha]].{{cite news |url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/entertainment/3102 |title=Fanaa: Proof of Yaaraa’s immaturity |language=Dhivehi |work=Haveeru |last=Nafiz |first=Ali |date=15 July 2010 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100718092407/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/?page=dates&date=2010-07-15 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=2010-07-18 |accessdate=18 July 2010 |df= }} Based on a novel published by Waheed titled ''Balgish'', he played the role of a gangster. Upon release, the film received mixed to negative reviews from critics; Ali Naafiz from ''Haveeru Daily'' classified the film as the "worst Maldivian film released so far" during the year, criticing the performance of lead. However, other critics found the performance of Azmeel to be "good for a starter". His debut performance garnered him a nomination for [[Gaumee Film Award for Best Actor|Best Actor]] at the [[6th Gaumee Film Awards]] while winning the Best Male Debut award at the Enchanteur Maldives Film Awards 2012.{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/entertainment/123762 |title=Winners of Maldives Film Awards |language=Dhivehi |work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=5 July 2012 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150402094000/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/entertainment/123762 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=19 September 2018 |accessdate=19 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}}{{cite news|url=https://avas.mv/9322 |title=Yoope crowned Best Actor, Niuma received Best Actress, and Happy Birthday as the Best Film |language=Dhivehi |work=Avas |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=23 October 2015 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180924050337/https://avas.mv/9322 |deadurl=no |archivedate=24 September 2018 |accessdate=24 September 2018}} The following year, Azmeel appeared in Aishath Ali Manik's romantic horror film ''[[Kuhveriakee Kaakuhey?]]'' (2011) opposite [[Aishath Rishmy]]. Inspired by the horror romantic thriller [[Bollywood]] film ''[[Darling (2007 Indian film)|Darling]]'' (2007), pre-production of the film was started in 2007 and shot in [[Sri Lanka]]. It revolves around a man who cheats on his wife with his secretary, and how his life slides to a haunting shift when he accidentally kills his mistress. The film and his performance received negative reviews from critics. "Azmeel does not seem to be in his form this time; He is weak in delivering sequences with different emotions. He tries hard in the emotional grief scenes, but fails to impress the audience". The film did little business at boxoffice and was declared a flop.{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/?page=details&id=111640 |title="Kuhveriyakee Kaakuhey" Whose fault? |language=Dhivehi |work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=19 May 2011 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110828170507/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/?page=details&id=111640 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=3 October 2018 |accessdate=3 October 2018}} His next release was a family drama ''Hiyy Yaara Dheefa'' (2011), written and directed by him, starred alongside [[Aishath Rishmy]], [[Niuma Mohamed]], [[Ali Seezan]] and [[Aminath Rasheedha]].{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/dhivehi/entertainment/maldives_film_industry/111417 |title="Hiyy Yaaraa Dheefa" premiered |language=Dhivehi |work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=13 October 2011 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111014210956/http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/dhivehi/entertainment/maldives_film_industry/111417 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=11 October 2018 |accessdate=11 October 2018}} The film received negative reviews from critics pointing similarities between [[Bollywood]] [[comedy-drama film]] ''[[Ishq (1997 film)|Ishq]]'' (1997) and [[Kundan Shah]]'s family drama ''[[Dil Hai Tumhaara]]'' (2002). The film revolves around four young people from different social classes fall in love with partners who do not meet with their parents' approval. The film did not succeed financially, and his work as a writer, actor and director was disapproved by critics.{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/dhivehi/entertainment/111747 |title="Hiyy Yaaraa Dheefa" review |language=Dhivehi |work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=20 October 2011 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111023000541/http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/dhivehi/entertainment/111747 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=11 October 2018 |accessdate=11 October 2018}} In 2016, Azmeel appeared in Hussain Munawwar's ''[[Neyngi Yaaru Vakivee]]'' alongside [[Aminath Rishfa]].{{cite news|url=https://sun.mv/70075 |title=Neyngi Yaaru Vakivee's First show full, Tickets available at four spots |language=Dhivehi |publisher=''Sun'' |date=26 February 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160606110604/https://sun.mv/70075 |archivedate=6 June 2016 |accessdate=6 June 2016}} Critics gave the film negative reviews and considered Azmeel's performance as Kamal, to be "boring" while criticising the character development.{{cite news|url=https://avas.mv/14598 |title=The actual reason of "Neyngi Yaaru Vakivee" |language=Dhivehi |publisher=''Avas'' |author=Nadheem, Ahmed |date=6 April 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160606101756/https://avas.mv/14598 |archivedate=6 June 2016 |accessdate=6 June 2016}} Despite the negative reviews, the film did average business at the end of its run.{{cite news|url=http://www.vaguthu.mv/evaguthu/entertainment/391632/ |title=Neyngi Yaaru Vakivee premiered to a positive response |language=Dhivehi |publisher=''Vaguthu'' |author=Jaishan, Ahmed |date=5 March 2016 {{Infobox person | name = Ahmed Azmeel | image = Azmeel 8GFA.jpg | caption = Azmeel at [[8th Gaumee Film Awards]] ceremony, 2017 | birth_name = | birth_date = | birth_place = | spouse = {{marriage|[[Aishath Rishmy]]|2007|2013|reason=div.}} | children = | occupation = Actor, choreographer | years_active = 2010-present | website = }} '''Ahmed Azmeel''' is a Maldivian film actor. ==Career== Azmeel made his film debut in [[Aishath Rishmy]]-directed ''[[Fanaa (2010 film)|Fanaa]]'' (2010) alongside Rishmy and [[Aminath Rasheedha]].{{cite news |url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/entertainment/3102 |title=Fanaa: Proof of Yaaraa’s immaturity |language=Dhivehi |work=Haveeru |last=Nafiz |first=Ali |date=15 July 2010 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100718092407/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/?page=dates&date=2010-07-15 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=2010-07-18 |accessdate=18 July 2010 |df= }} Based on a novel published by Waheed titled ''Balgish'', he played the role of a gangster. Upon release, the film received mixed to negative reviews from critics; Ali Naafiz from ''Haveeru Daily'' classified the film as the "worst Maldivian film released so far" during the year, criticing the performance of lead. However, other critics found the performance of Azmeel to be "good for a starter". His debut performance garnered him a nomination for [[Gaumee Film Award for Best Actor|Best Actor]] at the [[6th Gaumee Film Awards]] while winning the Best Male Debut award at the Enchanteur Maldives Film Awards 2012.{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/entertainment/123762 |title=Winners of Maldives Film Awards |language=Dhivehi |work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=5 July 2012 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150402094000/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/entertainment/123762 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=19 September 2018 |accessdate=19 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}}{{cite news|url=https://avas.mv/9322 |title=Yoope crowned Best Actor, Niuma received Best Actress, and Happy Birthday as the Best Film |language=Dhivehi |work=Avas |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=23 October 2015 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180924050337/https://avas.mv/9322 |deadurl=no |archivedate=24 September 2018 |accessdate=24 September 2018}} The following year, Azmeel appeared in Aishath Ali Manik's romantic horror film ''[[Kuhveriakee Kaakuhey?]]'' (2011) opposite [[Aishath Rishmy]]. Inspired by the horror romantic thriller [[Bollywood]] film ''[[Darling (2007 Indian film)|Darling]]'' (2007), pre-production of the film was started in 2007 and shot in [[Sri Lanka]]. It revolves around a man who cheats on his wife with his secretary, and how his life slides to a haunting shift when he accidentally kills his mistress. The film and his performance received negative reviews from critics. "Azmeel does not seem to be in his form this time; He is weak in delivering sequences with different emotions. He tries hard in the emotional grief scenes, but fails to impress the audience". The film did little business at boxoffice and was declared a flop.{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/?page=details&id=111640 |title="Kuhveriyakee Kaakuhey" Whose fault? |language=Dhivehi |work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=19 May 2011 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110828170507/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/?page=details&id=111640 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=3 October 2018 |accessdate=3 October 2018}} His next release was a family drama ''[[Hiyy Yaara Dheefa]]'' (2011), written and directed by him, starred alongside [[Aishath Rishmy]], [[Niuma Mohamed]], [[Ali Seezan]] and [[Aminath Rasheedha]].{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/dhivehi/entertainment/maldives_film_industry/111417 |title="Hiyy Yaaraa Dheefa" premiered |language=Dhivehi |work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=13 October 2011 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111014210956/http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/dhivehi/entertainment/maldives_film_industry/111417 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=11 October 2018 |accessdate=11 October 2018}} The film received negative reviews from critics pointing similarities between [[Bollywood]] [[comedy-drama film]] ''[[Ishq (1997 film)|Ishq]]'' (1997) and [[Kundan Shah]]'s family drama ''[[Dil Hai Tumhaara]]'' (2002). The film revolves around four young people from different social classes fall in love with partners who do not meet with their parents' approval. The film did not succeed financially, and his work as a writer, actor and director was disapproved by critics.{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/dhivehi/entertainment/111747 |title="Hiyy Yaaraa Dheefa" review |language=Dhivehi |work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=20 October 2011 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111023000541/http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/dhivehi/entertainment/111747 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=11 October 2018 |accessdate=11 October 2018}} In 2016, Azmeel appeared in Hussain Munawwar's ''[[Neyngi Yaaru Vakivee]]'' alongside [[Aminath Rishfa]].{{cite news|url=https://sun.mv/70075 |title=Neyngi Yaaru Vakivee's First show full, Tickets available at four spots |language=Dhivehi |publisher=''Sun'' |date=26 February 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160606110604/https://sun.mv/70075 |archivedate=6 June 2016 |accessdate=6 June 2016}} Critics gave the film negative reviews and considered Azmeel's performance as Kamal, to be "boring" while criticising the character development.{{cite news|url=https://avas.mv/14598 |title=The actual reason of "Neyngi Yaaru Vakivee" |language=Dhivehi |publisher=''Avas'' |author=Nadheem, Ahmed |date=6 April 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160606101756/https://avas.mv/14598 |archivedate=6 The film did little business at boxoffice and was declared a flop.{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/?page=details&id=111640 |title="Kuhveriyakee Kaakuhey" Whose fault? |language=Dhivehi |work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=19 May 2011 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110828170507/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/?page=details&id=111640 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=28 August 2011 |accessdate=3 October 2018}} His next release was a family drama ''[[Hiyy Yaara Dheefa]]'' (2011), written and directed by him, starred alongside [[Aishath Rishmy]], [[Niuma Mohamed]], [[Ali Seezan]] and [[Aminath Rasheedha]].{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/dhivehi/entertainment/maldives_film_industry/111417 |title="Hiyy Yaaraa Dheefa" premiered |language=Dhivehi |work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=13 October 2011 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111014210956/http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/dhivehi/entertainment/maldives_film_industry/111417 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=14 October 2011 |accessdate=11 October 2018}} The film received negative reviews from critics pointing similarities between [[Bollywood]] [[comedy-drama film]] ''[[Ishq (1997 film)|Ishq]]'' (1997) and [[Kundan Shah]]'s family drama ''[[Dil Hai Tumhaara]]'' (2002). The film did not succeed financially, and his work as a writer, actor and director was disapproved by critics.{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/dhivehi/entertainment/111747 |title="Hiyy Yaaraa Dheefa" review |language=Dhivehi |work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=20 October 2011 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111023000541/http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/dhivehi/entertainment/111747 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=23 October 2011 |accessdate=11 October 2018}} In 2016, Azmeel appeared in Hussain Munawwar's ''[[Neyngi Yaaru Vakivee]]'' alongside [[Aminath Rishfa]].{{cite news|url=https://sun.mv/70075 |title=Neyngi Yaaru Vakivee's First show full, Tickets available at four spots |language=Dhivehi |publisher=''Sun'' |date=26 February 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160606110604/https://sun.mv/70075 |archivedate=6 June 2016 |accessdate=6 June 2016}} Critics gave the film negative reviews and considered Azmeel's performance as Kamal, to be "boring" while criticising the character development.{{cite news|url=https://avas.mv/14598 |title=The actual reason of "Neyngi Yaaru Vakivee" |language=Dhivehi |publisher=''Avas'' |author=Nadheem, Ahmed |date=6 April 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160606101756/https://avas.mv/14598 |archivedate=6 June 2016 |accessdate=6 June 2016}} Despite the negative reviews, the film did average business at the end of its run.{{cite news|url=http://www.vaguthu.mv/evaguthu/entertainment/391632/ |title=Neyngi Yaaru Vakivee premiered to a positive response |language=Dhivehi |publisher=''Vaguthu'' |author=Jaishan, Ahmed |date=5 March 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160606110957/http://www.vaguthu.mv/evaguthu/entertainment/391632/ |archivedate=6 June 2016 |accessdate=6 June 2016}} His next release of the year was [[Ali Seezan]]-directed romantic film ''[[Vafaatheri Kehiveriya]]'' alongside [[Maleeha Waheed]].{{cite news|url=https://avas.mv/16116 |title="Vafaatheriya Kehiveriya" is almost complete: Seezan |language=Dhivehi |publisher=''Avas'' |author=Maahaa, Aishath|date=9 April 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160609121943/https://avas.mv/16116 |archivedate=9 June 2016 |accessdate=9 June 2016}} The film received a mixed to negative reception from critics.{{cite news|url=https://avas.mv/18132 |title="Vafaatheriya Kehiveriya" is not bad: Here is the reason behind its failure |language=Dhivehi |publisher=''Avas'' |author=Nadheem, Ahmed |date=5 June 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160606082514/https://avas.mv/18132 |archivedate=6 June 2016 |accessdate=6 June 2016}} [[Yoosuf Shafeeu]]-directed ''[[Baiveriyaa]]'' (2016), a comedy film featuring an ensemble cast was his second release of the year.{{cite news|url=https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/10286 |title=Last film of the year, "Baiveriyaa" releasing today |language=Dhivehi |work=Mihaaru |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=14 December 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180330145254/https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/10286 |deadurl=no |archivedate=30 March 2018 |accessdate=30 March 2018 |df=dmy-all}} The film revolves around an aspiring actress who flees from her family to pursue a career in the industry and the suspicions and confusions that arise.{{cite news|url=https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/11095 |title=Two shows of "Baiveriya" screening at olympus this week |language=Dhivehi |work=Mihaaru |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=3 January 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180330143550/https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/11095 |deadurl=no |archivedate=30 March 2018 |accessdate=30 March 2018 |df=dmy-all}} Upon release the film was positively received by critics. Nazim Hassan of ''Avas'' applauded the comic timing of the characters and mentioned that Azmeel showed "improvements from his earlier work".{{cite news|url=https://avas.mv/26970 |title=Baiveriyaa: A fun and entertaining film |language=Dhivehi |work=Avas |last=Hassan |first=Nazim |date=17 December 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180330145015/https://avas.mv/26970 |deadurl=no |archivedate=30 March 2018 |accessdate=30 March 2018 |df=dmy-all}} The film emerged as one of the highest grossing Maldivian films of the year.{{cite news|url=https://avas.mv/26970 |title=What was the best film of last year? |language=Dhivehi |work=Mihaaru |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=2 January 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180330150107/https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/10813 |deadurl=no |archivedate=30 March 2018 |accessdate=30 March 2018 |df=dmy-all}} In 2018, Azmeel appeared in Mariyam Moosa's directorial debut romantic film ''[[Thiya Loaibaa Dhurah]]''.{{cite news|url=https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/27018 |title="Thiya Loaibaa Dhurah" might turn out to be a beautiful romantic film |language=Dhivehi |work=Mihaaru |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=23 November 2017 |accessdate=18 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}} The entire film was shot in Sri Lanka.{{cite news|url=https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/33272 |title=A new teaser of "Thiya Loaibaa Dhurah" released |language=Dhivehi |work=Mihaaru |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=24 March 2018 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180328101423/https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/33272 |deadurl=no |archivedate=28 March 2018 |accessdate=18 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}} It was moderately received by critics; Aminath Lubaa reviewing from Sun praised the music and story of the film though she opined the performance from the actors including Azmeel, could have been better.{{cite news|url=https://sun.mv/104553 |title="Thiya Loaibaa Dhurah" review; a film for lovers |language=Dhivehi |work=Sun |last=Luba |first=Aminath |date=21 April 2018 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180918081157/https://archive.mv/dv/articles/6kdQ4 |deadurl=no |archivedate=18 September 2018 |accessdate=18 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}} In May 2018, it was premiered in Sri Lanka, and played two housefull shows at [[Mount Lavinia Hotel|Mount Lavinia Cinema]].{{cite news|url=https://raajje.mv/news/32308 |title=Two housefull shows of "Thiya Loaibaa Dhurah" showed in Lanka |language=Dhivehi |work=Raajje.mv |last=Waheed |first=Thahaarath Mohamed |date=11 May 2018 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180918081949/https://raajje.mv/news/32308 |deadurl=no |archivedate=18 September 2018 |accessdate=18 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}} ==Personal life== In May 2007, Azmeel married one of his co-stars [[Aishath Rishmy]]; with whom he shared screen space in many songs.{{cite web|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/entertainment/47345 |title=Rishmy and Azey getting married on thursday |publisher=''Haveeru Daily'' |author=Ahmed, Fazeena |language=Dhivehi |date=24 May 2007 |accessdate=8 October 2012 }}{{dead link|date=June 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} The couple were divorced in 2013. ==Filmography== {| class="wikitable sortable plainrowheaders" |- style="background:#ccc; {{Infobox person | name = Ahmed Azmeel | image = Azmeel 8GFA.jpg | caption = Azmeel at [[8th Gaumee Film Awards]] ceremony, 2017 | birth_name = | birth_date = | birth_place = | spouse = {{marriage|[[Aishath Rishmy]]|2007|2013|reason=div.}} | children = | occupation = Actor, choreographer | years_active = 2010-present | website = }} '''Ahmed Azmeel''' is a Maldivian film actor. ==Career== Azmeel made his film debut in [[Aishath Rishmy]]-directed ''[[Fanaa (2010 film)|Fanaa]]'' (2010) alongside Rishmy and [[Aminath Rasheedha]].{{cite news |url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/entertainment/3102 |title=Fanaa: Proof of Yaaraa’s immaturity |language=Dhivehi |work=Haveeru |last=Nafiz |first=Ali |date=15 July 2010 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100718092407/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/?page=dates&date=2010-07-15 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=2010-07-18 |accessdate=18 July 2010 |df= }} Based on a novel published by Waheed titled ''Balgish'', he played the role of a gangster. Upon release, the film received mixed to negative reviews from critics; Ali Naafiz from ''Haveeru Daily'' classified the film as the "worst Maldivian film released so far" during the year, criticing the performance of lead. However, other critics found the performance of Azmeel to be "good for a starter". His debut performance garnered him a nomination for [[Gaumee Film Award for Best Actor|Best Actor]] at the [[6th Gaumee Film Awards]] while winning the Best Male Debut award at the Enchanteur Maldives Film Awards 2012.{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/entertainment/123762 |title=Winners of Maldives Film Awards |language=Dhivehi |work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=5 July 2012 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150402094000/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/entertainment/123762 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=2 April 2015 |accessdate=19 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}}{{cite news|url=https://avas.mv/9322 |title=Yoope crowned Best Actor, Niuma received Best Actress, and Happy Birthday as the Best Film |language=Dhivehi |work=Avas |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=23 October 2015 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180924050337/https://avas.mv/9322 |deadurl=no |archivedate=24 September 2018 |accessdate=24 September 2018}} The following year, Azmeel appeared in Aishath Ali Manik's romantic horror film ''[[Kuhveriakee Kaakuhey?]]'' (2011) opposite [[Aishath Rishmy]]. Inspired by the horror romantic thriller [[Bollywood]] film ''[[Darling (2007 Indian film)|Darling]]'' (2007), pre-production of the film was started in 2007 and shot in [[Sri Lanka]]. It revolves around a man who cheats on his wife with his secretary, and how his life slides to a haunting shift when he accidentally kills his mistress. The film and his performance received negative reviews from critics. "Azmeel does not seem to be in his form this time; He is weak in delivering sequences with different emotions. He tries hard in the emotional grief scenes, but fails to impress the audience". The film did little business at boxoffice and was declared a flop.{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/?page=details&id=111640 |title="Kuhveriyakee Kaakuhey" Whose fault? |language=Dhivehi |work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=19 May 2011 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110828170507/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/?page=details&id=111640 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=28 August 2011 |accessdate=3 October 2018}} His next release was a family drama ''[[Hiyy Yaara Dheefa]]'' (2011), written and directed by him, starred alongside [[Aishath Rishmy]], [[Niuma Mohamed]], [[Ali Seezan]] and [[Aminath Rasheedha]].{{cite news |url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/dhivehi/entertainment/maldives_film_industry/111417 |title="Hiyy Yaaraa Dheefa" premiered |language=Dhivehi |work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=13 October 2011 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111014210956/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/entertainment/maldives_film_industry/111417# |deadurl=yes |archivedate=2011-10-14 |accessdate=11 October 2018 |df= }} The film received negative reviews from critics pointing similarities between [[Bollywood]] [[comedy-drama film]] ''[[Ishq (1997 film)|Ishq]]'' (1997) and [[Kundan Shah]]'s family drama ''[[Dil Hai Tumhaara]]'' (2002). The film revolves around four young people from different social classes fall in love with partners who do not meet with their parents' approval. The film did not succeed financially, and his work as a writer, actor and director was disapproved by critics.{{cite news |url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/dhivehi/entertainment/111747 |title="Hiyy Yaaraa Dheefa" review |language=Dhivehi |work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=20 October 2011 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111023000541/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/entertainment/111747# |deadurl=yes |archivedate=2011-10-23 |accessdate=11 October 2018 |df= }} In 2016, Azmeel appeared in Hussain Munawwar's ''[[Neyngi Yaaru Vakivee]]'' alongside [[Aminath Rishfa]].{{cite news|url=https://sun.mv/70075 |title=Neyngi Yaaru Vakivee's First show full, Tickets available at four gave the film negative reviews and considered Azmeel's performance as Kamal, to be "boring" while criticising the character development.{{cite news|url=https://avas.mv/14598 |title=The actual reason
